reviewText: This is what I liked about the DVD:1) It's short2) It made me sweat (it takes a lot to make me sweat, an indication that this is an intense workout)3) Amy is a good instructor4) You can follow another instructor on screen for an easier, lower impact workoutNow for the bad news:1) The cackling ladies in the background are annoying, shrieking at times2) If you follow Amy, like I did, it is very high impact (I'm only 27 and very active, an exercise junkie, and I thought I might injure myself while doing this DVD)3) Some of the moves are performed so fast (the lunges during the strength portion, for example) that it would be hard to perform them safely and effectively, especially for a beginner.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This work out is pretty challenging and you will sweat.  It gets a bit boring after a few times, but you'll still get a work out. The girls in the back are quite annoying, but Amy is not so bad.  Although Amy recommends 3lb weights, i use 5lbs and i'm thinking of moving up a few pounds. i guess it all depends on your level. The speed between exercises is a decent pace and you get plenty of repetitions/sets. I also recommend the body circuit work out by Michelle Dozoi called "total body breakthru - body circuit" (or something along those lines, I can't remember the exact word) which is  bit more challenging I think.
Title: N/A

reviewText: It you need a good workout this is the DVD for you. I was SHOCK and PLEASED all in one!!! Ms. Amy doesn't play and she get right down to business and you break a sweat fast. And I'm still using the workout DVD!!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: It is rare to find a workout that is not only geared to specifically work the biggest problem areas for a woman...but, even more importantly that burns mega calories without feeling ghastly hard to do, and with an instructor who makes every move simple because of amazingly good cueing AND also builds muscle so that you continue burning more calories even during rest...It matters not if you were picked last in every p.e. class growing up because of your lack of coordination or ability...or if you are an advanced workout afficianado...this one will still be your favorite.The moves are explained perfectly so you can follow along easily yet the promise of "ultimate fat burn" holds true. I have a Polar F11 heart rate monitor so I'm well aware of exactly how many calories I burn per workout & this one delivers...twice as many calories burned as most of my workouts!But do I feel crippled later because of it? Absolutely not...I feel energized and wonderful...just as this instructor is througout the entire dvdBeginner? Follow along to the "real person" on the dvd who is still getting into shape and does simpler moves. You'll still understand all moves perfectly and easily.More advanced? You'll get a fabulous workout. A rare find to burn this many calories in cardio and still get ultimate strength training in easy-to-follow but excellent steps.I have a few standards that I love in my collection...the S.W.A.T cardio dvd, dvds by the trainers of the Biggest Loser (because of great cardio, strength training and not having to be a professional dancer to figure out how to do moves correctly) but this one just hit top billing.I was floored with how many calories this burned when it went by so quickly and smoothly. A great find for any workout dvd collection.
summary: I have 75 workout dvds...and this is one of the very best!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I just finished watching this DVD for the first time. The moves are simple and at worst, I had to watch for a few seconds before jumping in. The workout is a good length- 40 minutes. I couldn't do it all today, but I was proud to be able to keep up the fast pace for most of it- that'll give me something to work on for the future.I'm using it for the "cardio" portion of a regime explained in the book "Complete Book of Abs for Women," which has a lot of calisthenics type exercises for the other days.
summary: This is the perfect intermediate level aerobic workout
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a very well done DVD that gives a full body workout in just 40 minutes. The workout alternates circuits of cardio and strength -- 2 sets of each with an additional warm up and cool down.  The cardio was intense and kept my heart rate up, even during the strength sections.  Amy Dixon is upbeat without being irritating and cues the moves perfectly.  There is one exerciser who provides low impact modifications, but most of the moves are sufficiently low impact that I only used a couple of the modifications.  I really enjoyed this workout --  very efficient and effective.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Well, on the positive side - the instructor is nice and encouraging, at least some of the moves are new and interesting. But here's what I didn't like:- it is short - 38 min- I found the women in the background annoying with their 'enthusiastic' oohs and aahs and yeahs- it is not challenging, I have no idea how you are supposed to burn 'up to 500 kcal' in one session. I am a 5'7'', 143 lbs woman, I did all the advanced moves except for one round of jumping jacks and burned 185 kcalI would definitely recommend the 'old' WH DVDs instead - "The Wedding Workout" and "Train for your body type"
summary: not as good as I expected it to be..

reviewText: Easy, low reps count. Amy is a great instructor, but I believe this workout falls short to burn fat, to be honest. I would recommend it for beginners.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This workout video includes moves to shape up and tone muscles. I really like it and will continue to use it. Thanks.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I used to do low impact aerobics back in the day (late 80s, early 90s) and after years of running, yoga, pilates, tae bo, belly dancing, etc etc (all things I love to do) it was  fun to try something different yet familiar. The moves aren't terribly creative or challenging, there are a couple hi-impact parts, and the chatter is a bit inane and irritating, but I have done this DVD twice and my butt/thighs are soooo sore - that makes me very happy.  The squats and lunges are great.  It made me sweat.  I am in very good shape from all the other stuff I do, but my butt is my problem area - I want it to be firmer and rounder.  This will help (the tae bo DVD for lower body bootcamp is really good too).  I lead a fitness club for 18 year old girls at a private school, and they really didn't like the workout at all - b/c it was challenging.  I liked it and plan to continue to use it as part of my own workout - that says a lot b/c I have a lot of DVDs that I am quite disappointed with and never use.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I received this DVD in record time and used it the same day.  I just love it.  It is quite a work out, but I felt really good after.  If there is a con to this it is all the advertising before the work out starts.  You can't fast forward to the workout either.  I feel if I'm paying for the work out DVD I shouldn't have to waste my time with advertising, I want to get right to it.  I highly recommend this work out DVD.
summary: Ultimate Fat Burn purchased on Amazon
Title: N/A

reviewText: I often read Womens Health, so when I saw they brought out some exercise dvds, I snapped them up.  They are really good and I love this one in particular.It's a fantastic aerobic/toning workout and Amy Dixon cues really well and makes this fun and is encouraging and motivating.  I haven't done or seen a workout of hers, but I'm so impressed with this.  If you put in a lot of effort on this, you will get a lot of results.  It's tough but great and fun to do.  It's easy to follow and do and she tells you often throughout that you can do it and to push yourself a little harder.  The cardio moves are athletic style (like kickboxing, jogging and ski moves) and the toning moves are classic kinds.  You have easier options to choose from so that makes it fairly do-able for many people.I really recommend this dvd as it's so well put together with the right type of exercises to get you in tip top shape, and an instructor who's not annoying but motivating and makes this an enjoyable workout.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I finally received my DVD's based on a recommendation by a friend, and I am SO happy that I did.  These new Women's Health workouts are so far superior to anything else I have, it's ridiculous.  The star Amy Dixon has more energy than anyone I've ever seen.  Seriously.  It must be a redhead thing.  I couldn't recommend them enough.I would definitely say you should get both of these tapes to mix it up a bit, but for anyone just deciding between the two, here's a word of advice based on my initial testing...  The Ten Minute one is definitely for everyone.  It's amazing because who can't workout for ten minutes?  And there's four different ones.  But the Ultimate Fat Burn, while personally is my favorite, is definitely a little harder of a workout.  If you're just a beginner, it may be a little difficult for you.  But like I said before, I'd get them both.  Slow days?  Ten Minute Workout.  Harder Days?  Ultimate Fat Burn.I hope this helps.  They really are amazing tapes.  I hope they make more.  The look of them is really different than anything I've seen.  It's not just in an empty room.  It really helps.Enjoy them, and happy working out!
summary: SO much better than your average workout DVD.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Amy Dixon is without a doubt one of the most energetic, engaging, and motivating instructors I have seen on a workout DVD.  Sometimes these things can get dull and boring, but not Ultimate Fat Burn!It is recommended that you use 3-pound hand weights for the strength sets, so you will want to get some if you don't already have them.  There's a brief warm up, a strength set, a cardio set, a second strength set (my favorite part of the workout), and a final cardio, followed by a cool-down and stretch segment.I think the workout is fun, and in my opinion, pretty challenging.  I would not recommend it for beginners.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Women's Health Ultimate Fat Burn was excellent. I felt like I really burned calories. The routine was never boring and I got to do work on every part of my body. It was long enough without being too long and I feel like my heart rate was elevated for a good clip of time. The cuing was perhaps the *best* cuing I have ever seen on any DVD to date. No fumbling. No false steps. Amy Dixon was right on point, always remembering that I was seeing a mirror image of what she was doing. Ms. Dixon was also not patronizing, not annoying and just encouraging enough that when I wanted to stop a rep, I just kept going. I really sweated with this workout and I enjoyed it a lot.  Highly recommended!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Personally I think this workout is worthless - there is nothing difficult about it and I didn't even break a sweat.  My mom tried this workout as well and said the same thing.  While the instruction is fine and Amy Dixon is a decent instructor, if you're looking for a challenge, this isn't the DVD for you.

reviewText: Awesome workout! Gets me sweatin big time! I love all the hops and leaps she adds in! This is one everybody needs to have in their collection!
Title: N/A

reviewText: While this is a short workout, I loved every minute of it.  Amy Dixon does intervals in this workout, which breaks it up nicely so there is a lot of variety (I didn't get bored during this workout!) She starts with a nice brisk warm-up, and then does alternating strength and cardio intervals.  The cardio intervals really got my heart rate up and moving without having me totally gasping.  I loved all the varied moves and jumps she added--it really made the workout fun, and it was over before I knew it!  The strength intervals had a lot of varied moves as well, although for my fitness level I could have used 5-pound weights rather than the 3-pound recommended weights.  She does move a bit fast, and the first time you do this I would recommend that you watch her do a move one time before attempting it.  However, like others have said, she is good at cueing and lets you know precisely when something different is coming up.Overall, I would definitely recommend this workout to anyone.  It is tough, but Amy Dixon is very motivating (and NOT annoying). While I don't know if it will burn 500 calories, I definitely felt like I WORKED OUT and had fun doing it.  I was absolutely drenched in sweat and had an endorphin high when it was over.I have tried one other Women's Health workout (Perfect Body Workout), and while I did like it, I wasn't entirely sold on these workouts.  However, after trying this one, I will definitely be purchasing more!
summary: Left me sweaty, tired, and feeling good!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I love this workout. This is the 1st Women's Health DVD I bought and I wasn't disappointed. I have never been big into weights, always focusing on the cardio instead. I like how you alternate between weights and cardio during the 1/2 hour. I also like how easy the moves were and how well Amy Dixon explains them. I hate it when I buy a cardio DVD to try and the moves are too complicated and by the time you realize you aren't sweating because you can't keep up, you have wasted your time and then don't get in a good calorie burn for the day. Nothing is more frustrating to a morning exerciser than that! Getting up early for no sweat! I also like how the woman doing the DVD are all different shapes and sizes. No one is perfect and it's really encouraging to see that in a fitness DVD. Worth the money!! I use this over and over!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a really short video, which is too bad. I like this better than Amy Dixon's Women's Health Perfect Body DVD because it's set up with intervals, instead of separate cardio and strength. Since it keeps changing, your heartrate stays up and it stays interesting. My heartrate is usually around 50-60% of maximum. I like Amy's cheerful style that doesn't seem to fake.
Title: N/A

reviewText: There are many reasons to recommend this video: the production values are excellent, Amy Dixon is a great cuer and the cues are mirrored (every workout video should do this-period) and there are many intelligent touches that other videos would do well to follow (for example, when Amy says to follow one exerciser for modifications, the camera cuts to that person who is in the front row, unobscured by other exercisers.) There is a good combination of compound weight moves and somewhat basic cardio, including kickboxing--although I wish the ratio were a little more balanced. There is more cardio than weight work here. I really liked this video the first time I did it.Cut to a few weeks later. The background exercisers are having a good time. TOO good of a time. I am not normally bothered by background exercisers hooting and hollering but there is a lot of it. And everything Amy says that is even mildly amusing is met by screams of laughter. This happens repeatedly. Over time, the dread factor started creeping in. I start cringing whenever I know a "punchline" is coming.It's ridiculous, right? And yet, I may in the end not be able to get past it. A remark like, "I'm a little afraid of the sun" is just not worthy of a round of gut-busting laughter the first time you hear it. A workout I enjoyed on the first go around is approaching onerous on the 5th or 6th go-round. I'm going to take this DVD out of rotation for a while.I don't know about her other Women's Health DVD's (this is the only one I have) but I do love Amy Dixon as an instructor-she enunciates clearly, she gives great form tips, she is motivating but low key-and am a big fan of her Kicking Strength workout which is also cardio/toning mix. Without the laugh track.
Title: N/A
